languages.name: Python
languages.details: Python was my first language; I started learning it at secondary school in 2012. I love how versatile and easy to pick up it is. I've used it for many of my school & university projects, and have also used it extensively during my placement year at Egress.

languages.name: C++
languages.details: Started in 2017 during university, where I used the language to learn the fundamentals of programming. It's an enjoyable language as there's a lot it can do that other languages, such as Python, can't.

languages.name: C#
languages.details: Started in 2017 during university, where I wrote a number of projects in the language. C# is a great language as it's one of the most supported languages currently, and is used in a wide range of applications.

languages.name: java
languages.details: In 2017 at university I used java and android studio to make an app that encrypted messages via the mobile's sensors. I had fun with this project, and I'm certain that java has more uses for me to discover.

languages.name: node.js
languages.details: Started late 2020, on some web development tutorials using node.js with the express framework. So far I've enjoyed using the language as it's quite easy to pick up and begin to use. I am currently using it for this very websites backend server!
